Company2: Marie Cruz - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: STEM in the Garden: How to Monitor Plants with IoT Sensors and Grafana Cloud
Abstract:
Are you a parent who wants to do a fun project with your kids? Are you trying to keep your plants alive? Or are you considering using an IoT device to monitor your plant's soil moisture level?

If any of the following resonates, this talk is for you!

Company2: Gresshma Atluri - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: IoT Supply Chain Security: Defending Connected Device Ecosystems from Cyberattacks
Abstract: Learn proven strategies to defend IoT ecosystems from supply chain cyberattacks. Discover how hardware attestation, network segmentation, and behavioral analytics can reduce IoT security incidents by 60%+ based on real-world data

Company2: Silpa Potluri - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: IoT Payment Systems: Microservices Architecture for Connected Devices
Abstract: Learn how payment gateways evolved from monoliths to microservices to handle billions of IoT device transactions, enabling real-time processing with 99.99% uptime and 40% cost reduction through scalable, cloud-native architectures.

Company2: Swetha Lakkaraju - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: Decoupling Legacy Banking: Modular Core Strategies for Speed, Scale, and Innovation
Abstract: Legacy banking systems drain budgets and block innovation. Learn how modular core architectures slash costs, cut outages by 70%+, and triple feature delivery quipping banks to scale, innovate, and thrive in the digital era.

Company2: Madhu Niranjan Reddy Puduru - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: Edge AI for Smart Camera IoT Devices: Real-Time Image Processing Without Cloud Dependencies
Abstract: Transform dumb IoT cameras into intelligent edge devices! Learn how to deploy neural networks on $10 hardware, process images in real-time without cloud, save bandwidth, extend battery life, and protect privacy. From smart doorbells to industrial vision - make your IoT cameras think locally!

Company2: Ramakrishna Ambati - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: Secure IoT Edge Architecture: Predictive Maintenance for Medical Diagnostic Systems
Abstract: Real IoT deployment: 157 medical devices, 97.8% uptime, $437K savings, 91.3% failure prediction accuracy. Edge computing + ML + Zero Trust security = proven results. Learn the architecture that transformed healthcare maintenance operations.

Company2: Bhanudeepti Chinta - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: IoT Data Lakehouse: Scalable Architectures for Connected Device Analytics
Abstract: Learn how IoT Lakehouse architectures solve massive sensor data challenges by unifying streaming telemetry, device logs, and analytics in scalable platforms that power predictive maintenance, smart city monitoring, and connected device intelligence.

JobTitle1: Driving Strategic Growth for Global Customers
Title: Taming IoT Data Streams: Lessons in Managing Scale, Complexity, and Trust
Abstract: IoT devices generate massive streams of data, but the challenge is making that data reliable, secure, and usable at scale. Engineers face messy pipelines, outages, and governance needs. By improving how we manage streaming systems like Kafka, teamsfocus on building IoT apps that deliver real impact.

Company2: Ketul Dusane - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: Optimizing IoT Messaging at Scale: Data-Driven Strategies for Low Latency, High Throughput, and Resilience
Abstract: Learn how IoT platforms achieve sub-100ms latency and scale to millions of devices with data-driven strategies in caching, load balancing, and anomaly detection delivering resilient, energy-efficient messaging at global scale.

Company2: Manmohan Alla - Conf42 Internet of Things (IoT) 2025.pdf
Title: IoT Data Warehousing with Snowflake Feature Stores: 40% Cost Reduction Strategy
Abstract: Transform IoT data chaos into ML-ready features using Snowflake. Learn proven patterns that cut costs 40% while scaling from edge sensors to cloud analytics. Real case studies show how unified architecture eliminates data silos and accelerates IoT model deployment.
